Selected Answer: B
Private cloud deployment models are most likely to be limited in scalability. This is because a private cloud is typically dedicated to a single organization and relies on the organization's own infrastructure and resources. Consequently, the scalability is constrained by the physical and financial limits of the organization's hardware and data center capacity. In contrast, public clouds and other models such as hybrid or community clouds can leverage shared resources and infrastructure, providing greater scalability options.
